info.description: Get, Creation and management of Standing Orders
info.title: Standing Orders APIs

get.description: Retrieves the list of standing orders for a customer

parameters.name: debitCustomerId
parameters.description: Debtor customer details

parameters.name: standingOrderId
parameters.description: The unique standing order identifier

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Identifier of the account. Often referred to as the account number, yet for consistency this is always referred to as accountId. Accepts both IBAN & BBAN

parameters.name: orderingCustomerId
parameters.description: Indicates the customer id for the ordering customer

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: The identifier of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch.

parameters.description: The unique standing order identifier

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

page_size.description: The total number of records per page

page_start.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

total_size.description: The total number of records present

page_token.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request

displayNames.description: Name used for display or enrichment purposes

displayName.description: Contains the name used for display or enrichment purposes

accountWithBanks.description: Identifies the bank where the beneficiary maintains his account

accountWithBank.description: Identifies the bank where the beneficiary maintains his account

orderType.description: Identifies the type of the order. Possible values are Single, Ifdone, Revol, oco. Single order - only one order item may be input. If done order -  If one order gets executed, the other order is also executed immediately. Revolving order -  based on the condition specified, it will wait for both the deals to be executed simultaneously. OCO -If one order gets executed, then the other order gets cancelled.

paymentMethod.description: Method chosen to make the payment

currencyId.description: Identifier of the currency. This is the 3-letter ISO 4217 code of the currency.

frequency.description: Specifies the frequency in which the payment application(periodic payments) execute the payment instruction.

counterPartyAccountId.description: The identifier of the counter party's account

beneficiaryId.description: Indicates the Id of beneficiary when beneficiary details are stored

percentageOverCurrentBalance.description: This is used to specify a percentage value, which would be applied on the accounts excess amount(Accounts cleared balance - CURRENT.AMOUNT) to arrive at

payTo.description: This field holds the reason for change in IB.STATUS field.

currentFrequencyDate.description: Indicates the date based on current frequency

currentFrequency.description: Indicates the current frequency of the standing order

startDate.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

currentEndDate.description: Identifies the current end date of the standing order for the currency, amount and frequency specified. When the bank has received from the customer clear instructions which stipulate that the standing order must  only be executed during a determined period of time.  This is the date of the last execution of the standing order or when the customer has requested the bank to pay a certain amount during a determined period of time and then another amount starting from that date. In this case, this field specifies the end date of the first standing order amount.  After that date the second amount will then be executed.

futureNotice.description: Flag to indicate that the standing order should execute until future notice, i.e. until an end date is provided.

creditAccountId.description: Credit account identifier of the payment or transaction

creditAccountName.description: Account name details of the creditor

bankSortCode.description: The sort code or the national clearing code of the beneficiary bank.

beneficiaryBIC.description: BIC (Bank Identifier Code) of the beneficiary customer

beneficiaryIBAN.description: International Bank Account Number (IBAN) of the beneficiary account, required only for International transfers/payments outside the Bank. For example: GB98 MIDL07009312345678, FR7630006000011234567890189

beneficiaryOurCharges.description: Indicates the bearer of the charges. For example: BEN( All transaction charges are to be borne by the beneficiary customer.), OUR (All transaction charges are to be borne by the ordering customer.), SHA (Transaction charges on the Sender's side are to be borne by the ordering customer, transaction charges on the Receiver's side are to be borne by the beneficiary customer.)

paymentOrderProductName.description: Indicates the name of payment order product

beneficiaryCountryId.description: Country of the beneficiary account number. For example: US, IN, EU

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

code.description: The identifier of the error message
The identifier of the error message

message.description: The actual t24 error message for bad requests

type.description: The identifier of error type: Business

code.description: The identifier of the error message

message.description: The actual t24 error message caused by server

type.description: The identifier of error type: System

description.description: Contains the description of purpose of the payment.

responseCode.description: The user input to accept/reject the override.

beneficiaryNames.description: Short title or short name of the beneficiary account account

beneficiaryName.description: Short title or short name of the beneficiary

accountWithBanks.description: Identifies the bank where the beneficiary maintains his account

accountWithBank.description: Identifies the bank where the beneficiary maintains his account

displayNames.description: Name used for display or enrichment purposes

displayName.description: Contains the name used for display or enrichment purposes

beneficiaryBICNames.description: The name of the beneficiary bank

beneficiaryBICName.description: The name of the beneficiary bank

overrides.description: The override message is captured  that was generated at the time of commitment of the transaction to the database.

override.description: The override message is captured  that was generated at the time of commitment of the transaction to the database.

paymentMethod.description: Method chosen to make the payment

currentFrequency.description: Indicates the current frequency of the standing order

currentEndDate.description: Identifies the current end date of the standing order for the currency, amount and frequency specified. When the bank has received from the customer clear instructions which stipulate that the standing order must  only be executed during a determined period of time.  This is the date of the last execution of the standing order or when the customer has requested the bank to pay a certain amount during a determined period of time and then another amount starting from that date. In this case, this field specifies the end date of the first standing order amount.  After that date the second amount will then be executed.

futureNotice.description: Flag to indicate that the standing order should execute until future notice, i.e. until an end date is provided.

counterPartyAccountId.description: The identifier of the counter party's account

startDate.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

frequency.description: Specifies the frequency in which the payment application(periodic payments) execute the payment instruction.

beneficiaryAccountId.description: Unique account identifier of the beneficiary account number.

beneficiaryId.description: Indicates the Id of beneficiary when beneficiary details are stored

beneficiaryReference.description: The reference which is provided to the beneficiary by the originator of payment

currencyId.description: Identifier of the currency. This is the 3-letter ISO 4217 code of the currency.

bankSortCode.description: The sort code or the national clearing code of the beneficiary bank.

beneficiaryIBAN.description: International Bank Account Number (IBAN) of the beneficiary account, required only for International transfers/payments outside the Bank. For example: GB98 MIDL07009312345678, FR7630006000011234567890189

beneficiaryBICCity.description: The city associated with beneficiary bank BIC (Bank Identifier Code)

beneficiaryBIC.description: BIC (Bank Identifier Code) of the beneficiary customer

currentFrequencyDate.description: Indicates the date based on current frequency

paymentOrderProductName.description: Indicates the name of payment order product

beneficiaryOurCharges.description: Indicates the bearer of the charges. For example: BEN( All transaction charges are to be borne by the beneficiary customer.), OUR (All transaction charges are to be borne by the ordering customer.), SHA (Transaction charges on the Sender's side are to be borne by the ordering customer, transaction charges on the Receiver's side are to be borne by the beneficiary customer.)

accountWithBankIBAN.description: This is the IBAN of the institution where beneficiary holds an account

paymentCategory.description: The purpose code for the payment. Should be one of the pre-defined purpose codes in the application and information will be used for payment processing

customerSpread.description: The spread that is applied to the published internal exchange rates to derive the final exchange rate or the customer rate for the transaction

customerRate.description: The exchange rate that is actually applied for currency conversion in case of transactions involving FX conversion.

paymentOrderVersion.description: Specifies the payment order screen which will be used when executing standing instruction

recordStatus.description: General status of the record. Possible values: - null - authorised - IHLD - input, on hold - INAU - input, not authorised - INA2 - input, authorised, pending second authorisation - INAO - input, not authorised with blocking overrides - RNAU - reversed, not authorised - RNAO - reversed, not authorised with blocking overrides

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

status.description: Status identifier of the account. The values are 'DELETED' if the account is closed, 'BLOCKED' is there are any posting restrictions & 'ENABLED' for active accounts.

transactionStatus.description: Contains the current status of the transaction. For example: 'ACCC': 'AcceptedSettlementCompleted' - Settlement on the creditor's account has been completed.'ACCP': 'AcceptedCustomerProfile' - Preceding check of technical validation was successful. Customer profile check was also successful.'CANC': 'Cancelled' Payment initiation has been cancelled before execution Remark: This codeis accepted as new code by ISO20022.'RCVD': 'Received' - Payment initiation has been received by the receiving agent.
